sentences.english: Before I got these, my allergies would turn into weeks-long sinus infections.
sentences.chinese: 在我開始使用前，過敏症狀已變成持續幾周的鼻炎。

sentences.english: "I would suggest they got a cholesterol test with these symptoms, " says Smith.
sentences.chinese: 有這此症狀的人，我會建議他們去檢查一下膽固醇。

sentences.english: Cattle in North Korea being checked for signs of FMD.
sentences.chinese: 正在查看朝鮮的牛是否有口蹄疫症狀。

sentences.english: Drinking potato juice every day can ease indigestion, a new study has found.
sentences.chinese: 一項新的調查，每天喝土豆汁可以消化不良的症狀。

sentences.english: Signs include exercise intolerance, but often there is only a heart murmur.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀症狀包括運動不耐，但大多數病例僅有心臟雜音。

sentences.english: How to relieve symptoms of hemorrhoids in this free home health video series.
sentences.chinese: 如何緩解這個免費的家庭健康系列影片痔瘡的症狀。

sentences.english: Gastritis may cause symptoms resembling those of peptic ulcer.
sentences.chinese: 胃炎可引起類似消化性潰瘍的症狀。

sentences.english: No patients had concomitant cardiac symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 沒有患者伴發心髒症狀。

sentences.english: Insomnia is both a symptom and a cause of depression and anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 失眠既是一種症狀又是導致沮喪和緊張的肇因。

sentences.english: Thoracic malformations, commonly known as chicken, children, the typical symptoms of calcium deficiency.
sentences.chinese: 胸廓發育畸形，俗稱雞胸，是兒童缺鈣的典型症狀。

sentences.english: What is the symptom of heart myositis?
Symptoms of anaemia include general fatigue and lassitude.
sentences.chinese: 貧血症狀包括全身疲勞和睏乏。

sentences.english: Conclusions Clinical diversity and diurnal fluctuation are the characteristics of DRD.
sentences.chinese: 結論DRD患者具有症狀多樣及日間波動的特點。

sentences.english: Irritative symptoms lessened with repeated exposures .
sentences.chinese: 刺激症狀隨着重複暴露而減輕。

sentences.english: Little moves pants and so on symptom sickness cards.
sentences.chinese: 少動氣短等症狀的病證。

sentences.english: Lehman Brothers was a symptom of a dysfunctional financial system and regulatory failure.
sentences.chinese: 雷曼兄弟是異化的金融系統和監管失敗的症狀。

definition: to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
to recur (of a disease)/to reappear/to relapse (into a former bad state)
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
